column4: hmmm when i try to mount a samba share, i get "smbfs: mount_data version 1684370019 is not supported"
hmmm when i try to mount a samba share, i get "smbfs: mount_data version 1684370019 is not supported" ... how do I fix this ?
!samba
eek why am i getting "files list file for package `capplets-data' is missing final newline" when i try to install anything ?
looks like the capplets-data package is slightly busticated - is there any more to the message?
errors while processing samba_3.0.14a-6ubuntu1_i386.deb
however, same thing happens when i try to do apt-get upgrade ... different package encounters errors :S
anything else?  maybe something that tells you where the files list file is?
here, i'll stick the output in a text file, and put it on my server ... one second
here is the error ... http://www.longpath.org/doomhamer/filemirror/dpkg_error.txt
try this: open /var/lib/dpkg/info/capplets-data.list and add a newline to the end of the file
uh ... this doesn't look good, there's a ton of gibberish at the end of the file ... :O
doh :)  here lemme give you mine...
here's a bit of it @^Nc^@^Oc^
www.linuxkungfu.org/tmp/capplets-data.list
would that file be different if i'm running KDE instead of Gnome ?
no, it's a list of files in the capplets-data package.  and anyway I run kde too :)
ah okay :) thanks
it's more like vmware than it is like wine
ah ... never really used either, i use QEMU to run a copy of winxp under ubuntu :P
